data.message: Hi. How about a Coca Cola bottle made of paper or some other biodegradeable material rather than the present ones littering our earth

replies.message:
Hi David, thanks for getting in touch. We’ve already been using renewable packaging innovations for many years, like the PlantBottle. The first fully recyclable plastic bottle made partly with a special plastic which comes from plant material, which means we don’t have to use as much petroleum-based plastic. 

We’re also proud to say that all of our bottles and cans in Great Britain are 100% recyclable and have been since 2012. This means that all our drinks packaging can be recycled at home or when you’re out and about.  We have embarked on a major review of our sustainable packaging strategy to understand what role we can play to unlock the full potential of a circular economy.  To keep up to date with all of our future sustainability announcements please visit www.coca-cola.co.uk/sustainability-section

hi coke- how long would your PlantBottle have sat in my local street unless i'd picked the damn thing up and binned it myself. Single use bottles are the problem - they have no value and too many of your delightful customers think its acceptable to chuck them wherever they like once they have drunk the contents - Oceans, lakes, rivers, my walk to school absolutely EVERYWHERE and YOU should be paying for the clean up.....
